subject: Re: [junit] Mock Objects
msgSnippet: ... Simple, global answer: test anything that you think might not work. Over time, you gain experience to make better judgments. ...
messageBody:
>So said akshatj_2000 on 2003-07-05 --------------------
>Hi
>I am new to Junit
>1. i am trying to test 2 classes - A and B , in the sense that
>one class derives from another one. I have some method
>say X in class B that class a method Y in A.
>How am i suppose to test the method X.
>Do i have to write a test case for method Y also.?
>Cant the Method Y be tested automatically when testing X.?

Simple, global answer: test anything that you think might not work. Over time, you gain experience to make better judgments.

>2. Do i have to write Test case for all the class i implement
>using "inheritance" . Cant i test all of them once?.

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
